author: natdwamena
title: Ubuntu Crypto Use Map DAO
description: Africa is a target for most innovative businesses that are integrating crypto use. How do we easily locate businesses adopting crypto use in Africa?

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposer has identified the problem of difficulty in locating businesses adopting crypto use in Africa and his solution to this problem is to develop a crypto use map DAO on the Cardano blockchain to organize and easily locate credible business locations with integrated crypto use.
 The proposer has indicated that, this proposal would add value to the Cardano blockchain by onboarding businesses onto the cardano ecosystem and adopting the use of the ADA coin in their businesses.
The key metrics and goals outlined in this proposal are in line with the challenge settings.
This proposal will go in a long way to move individual businesses from completely/partial cash system to cashless system which is going to reduce the rate of theft in our communities.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposer has provided the reader with a detailed timeline, budget breakdown, key milestones and details of team members to work on the project with their relevant profile links.
The 3 months timeline the team intend to deliver the project is ideal for them to complete the project and the amount they are requesting for would be enough to complete the project successfully.
The team members on this project have the relevant skills (developers, marketers, designers, Geospatial experts, web designers, etc) to complete this project successfully.  
The budget allocations are ideal to complete their respective items on the budget.
The proposer has also provided readers with key milestone to determine the success of the project.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposer has provided the community sufficient information that would be used to audit the progress and success of the project.
The project team is committed to provide the catalyst community with integrated progress reports which would be published monthly on the website and also document DApp development in Github.
They are also committed to provide funding updates, impact and progress report on Discord.
The proposer has provided the relevant links to their various platforms in the proposal.
The proposer has also provided the community with roadmap, milestones and KPIs to track the progress of the project.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal tries to create a map DAO as a tool to organize, locate and map functioning existing and new businesses that have integrated with crypto. The ideas and the background problem are presented in detail, where crypto users can locate and identify where and what businesses accept crypto as payments. The proposal explains the main potential risk which is the fear of crypto use by businesses in the informal sector. However, the proposers provide a reasonable mitigation plan by using education and demonstration about the benefit of using crypto for businesses.
f6_assessments.q1: This proposal has clear milestones grouped into 4 timelines consisting of phase A to phase D with a total time of 12 weeks. The proposal provided a breakdown budget divided into 8 parts such as App Development will cost $20000. However, the breakdown budget is not detailed enough and it can be better to provide more detailed budget information on each part such as cost per hour for the engineer or cost per item for hardware in the App Development part. The proposal provides detailed information about each of the team members consisting of background, experience, and relevant skills, and also attached LinkedIn link so its easily to verify their profile and credibility.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal is easy to track with the project report published monthly on the project website, the app development also can be tracked easily through their Github repository. This proposal uses 5 KPIs which are clear, measurable, and reasonable one of them is the number of downloads. However, it will be better if they also mentioned the detailed number of each KPI to indicate the success of the proposal such as the number of downloads more than 200K, etc.

f6_assessments.q0: Through the use of an open source application that would promote the usage of ADA for informal commercial transactions, the idea aims to enhance the value of the Cardano ecosystem. By offering an application that would set up a decentralized autonomous organization that would benefit the informal sector by increasing financial inclusion, simple access to clients, and effectively to map out business using crypto for ease of access, the idea appropriately addresses the difficulty. Since company owners employing cryptocurrencies would be exposed to a whole new audience as a result of this, the economy of Ghana and Africa as a whole would grow, which would have a significant positive impact on the informal sector.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal includes a thorough plan and timeline for the accomplishment of different project milestones, with an estimated completion time of around three months. A thorough budget was created, and it was projected to cost about $64,500. The team members working on this project have the necessary expertise and experience to complete it successfully, increasing the likelihood that tasks like software development, GIS, surveying, and NGO management will be successful.
f6_assessments.q2: Through regular progress reports and comprehensive github documentation of the app development process, the proposal illustrates how community members can audit the project. The project's milestones and roadmaps were laid out; among them is the deployment and completion of the application, which has no specific delivery date. The number of new Yoroi users, the number of application downloads, and other factors can be used to gauge the proposal's success. The plan considers the project's risks, such as public concern about the adopting of cryptocurrencies.
